Event.name: Patrolling
Event.definition:
<def-root>An individual or group, the <fen>Patrol</fen> moves through and examines a <fen>Ground</fen> in order to ensure that it is in a generally <fen>Desired_state_of_affairs</fen>, particularly that it is safe and contains no dangerous <fen>Unwanted_entity</fen>. Rather than moving through the <fen>Ground</fen>, the <fen>Patrol</fen> may simply move such that all the (relevant portions of) <fen>Ground</fen> can be observed and checked.
<ex><fex name="pat">Detective Jones</fex> <t>patrolled</t> <fex name="gro">the northern half of the building</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="pat">Security guards</fex> <t>patrolled</t> <fex name="unw">for intruders</fex> <fex name="tim">while the game was in progress</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Patrol
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The person (or group) who inspects the <fen>Ground</fen> to see that it is safe.
<ex><fex name="pat">Detective Jones</fex> <t>patrolled</t> the northern half of the building.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Ground
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The area that the <fen>Patrol</fen> inspects with to ensure its safety.
<ex>Four soldiers with submachine guns <t>patrolled</t> <fex name="gro">the room</fex>, and an officer made his rounds at frequent intervals.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Unwanted_entity
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An entity whose presence would impair the desirability or safety of the <fen>Ground</fen>.
<ex>Security guards <t>patrolled</t> <fex name="unw">for intruders</fex> while the game was in progress.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used for the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Patrol</fen> examines the <fen>Ground</fen>.
<ex><t>Policing</t> your neighborhood <fex name="mea">by walking your block and asking about new or unusual things</fex> can significantly improve your and your neighbors' safety.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The desired outcome of the patrolling. Normally this constituent is a PP Complement headed by <ment>for</ment>, or a <ment>to</ment>-marked VP Complement.
<ex><t>Patrol</t> all unlit areas <fex name="pur">to ensure no one is hiding there</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the <fen>Patrol</fen> inspects the <fen>Ground</fen>.
<ex>My officers have been <fex name="man">bravely</fex> <t>patrolling</t> that estate, on behalf of the community which we serve, and will continue to do so.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the extent to which the <fen>Patrol</fen> examines the <fen>Ground</fen>.
<ex> This section is <fex name="deg">thoroughly</fex> <t>policed</t> by the correctional officers every morning and evening.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Location_of_protagonist
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE is the position of the <fen>Patrol</fen> during the act of perception. Typically, it is expressed in a <ment>from</ment>-PP.
<ex>We'll have to <t>patrol</t> the roof <fex name="Location_of_protagonist">from a distance</fex>, avoiding the snipers' notice.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Desired_state_of_affairs
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The desirable state of affairs which the <fen>Patrol</fen> hopes to ensure by visiting <fen>Ground</fen>.
<ex>All our grounds are regularly <t>patrolled</t> <fex name="des">for safety</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Patrol</fen> examines the <fen>Ground</fen>.
<ex>Officers<t>policed</t> the parade grounds <fex name="tim">during the Memorial day events.</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The circumstances under which the <fen>Patrol</fen> examines the <fen>Ground</fen>.
<ex><fex name="cir">Under pressure to find something</fex>, the team <t>patrolled</t> the site for signs of illicit activity.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An entity used by the <fen>Patrol</fen> to scrutinize the <fen>Ground</fen>.
<ex>Scouts <t>patrolled</t> the beaches <fex name="inst">with binoculars</fex>, looking for aircraft.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.</def-root>

Arg.name: Descriptor
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A description of one of the participants in the patrolling event.
<ex>They <t>patrolled</t> the parade grounds, <fex name="des">unaware of the lurking danger</fex>.</ex>
<ex>An <fex name="des">American</fex> <t>patrol</t> encounted resistance in the area.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Members
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An indication of the members of the patrol.
<ex>We <t>patrolled</t> the area <fex name="mem">with thirty soldiers</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="mem">Our</fex> <t>patrol</t> was ambushed just outside the village.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The length of time of the patrol.
<ex>We've been <t>patrolling</t> <fex name="dur">for hours</fex> and haven't even seen anyone.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Co-participant
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Co-participant</fen> patrols along with the <fen>Patrol</fen>.
<ex>US troops <t>patrolled</t> the area <fex name="Co-participant">with Iraqi soldiers</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Vehicle
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Patrol</fen> may move around in a <fen>Vehicle</fen>.
<ex>We typically <t>patrolled</t> this area <fex name="veh">in heavily armored cars</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Possessor
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Possessor</fen> is the organization (usually a nation or group of nations) that orchestrates the patrol.
<ex>The bombmaker was found by a <fex name="pos">NATO</fex> <t>patrol</t>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: patrol.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: search an area to ensure safety or check for unexpected or undesirable situations.

lexUnit.name: police.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: search an area to ensure safety and legal conduct.

lexUnit.name: patrol [entity].n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a group engaged in patrolling.
